intro: Brachystegia mimosifolia, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and distinctive, flattened, woody pods. The tree typically grows in savanna woodlands and can reach heights of up to 15 meters. Its bark is often fissured and may exude a milky sap when damaged. The plant plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
